acknowledgments_t.description: Contains a list of acknowledgment elements.

items.description: Acknowledges contributions by describing those that contributed.

names.description: Contains the names of entities being recognized.

items.description: Contains the name of a single person.
items.title: Name of entity being recognized

names.title: List of acknowledged names

organization.description: Contains the name of a contributing organization being recognized.
organization.title: Contributing organization

summary.description: SHOULD represent any contextual details the document producers wish to make known about the acknowledgment or acknowledged parties.
examples: First analysis of Coordinated Multi-Stream Attack (CMSA)
summary.title: Summary of the acknowledgment

urls.description: Specifies a list of URLs or location of the reference to be acknowledged.

items.description: Contains the URL or location of the reference to be acknowledged.
items.title: URL of acknowledgment

urls.title: List of URLs

items.title: Acknowledgment

acknowledgments_t.title: List of acknowledgments

branches_t.description: Contains branch elements as children of the current element.

items.description: Is a part of the hierarchical structure of the product tree.

category.description: Describes the characteristics of the labeled branch.
category.title: Category of the branch

name.description: Contains the canonical descriptor or 'friendly name' of the branch.
name.title: Name of the branch

items.title: Branch

branches_t.title: List of branches

full_product_name_t.description: Specifies information about the product and assigns the product_id.

name.description: The value should be the product’s full canonical name, including version number and other attributes, as it would be used in a human-friendly document.
examples: Microsoft Host Integration Server 2006 Service Pack 1
name.title: Textual description of the product

product_identification_helper.description: Provides at least one method which aids in identifying the product in an asset database.

cpe.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) attribute refers to a method for naming platforms external to this specification.
cpe.title: Common Platform Enumeration representation

hashes.description: Contains a list of cryptographic hashes usable to identify files.

items.description: Contains all information to identify a file based on its cryptographic hash values.

file_hashes.description: Contains a list of cryptographic hashes for this file.

items.description: Contains one hash value and algorithm of the file to be identified.

algorithm.description: Contains the name of the cryptographic hash algorithm used to calculate the value.
algorithm.title: Algorithm of the cryptographic hash

value.description: Contains the cryptographic hash value in hexadecimal representation.
value.title: Value of the cryptographic hash

items.title: File hash

file_hashes.title: List of file hashes

filename.description: Contains the name of the file which is identified by the hash values.
filename.title: Filename

items.title: Cryptographic hashes

hashes.title: List of hashes

model_numbers.description: Contains a list of parts, or full model numbers.

items.description: Contains a part, or a full model number of the component to identify.
items.title: Model number

model_numbers.title: List of models

purl.description: The package URL (purl) attribute refers to a method for reliably identifying and locating software packages external to this specification.
purl.title: package URL representation

sbom_urls.description: Contains a list of URLs where SBOMs for this product can be retrieved.

items.description: Contains a URL of one SBOM for this product.
items.title: SBOM URL

sbom_urls.title: List of SBOM URLs

serial_numbers.description: Contains a list of parts, or full serial numbers.

items.description: Contains a part, or a full serial number of the component to identify.
items.title: Serial number

serial_numbers.title: List of serial numbers

skus.description: Contains a list of parts, or full stock keeping units.

items.description: Contains a part, or a full stock keeping unit (SKU) which is used in the ordering process to identify the component.
items.title: Stock keeping unit

skus.title: List of stock keeping units

x_generic_uris.description: Contains a list of identifiers which are either vendor-specific or derived from a standard not yet supported.

items.description: Provides a generic extension point for any identifier which is either vendor-specific or derived from a standard not yet supported.

namespace.description: Refers to a URL which provides the name and knowledge about the specification used or is the namespace in which these values are valid.
namespace.title: Namespace of the generic URI

items.title: Generic URI

x_generic_uris.title: List of generic URIs

product_identification_helper.title: Helper to identify the product

full_product_name_t.title: Full product name

lang_t.description: Identifies a language, corresponding to IETF BCP 47 / RFC 5646. See IETF language registry: https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry
lang_t.title: Language type

notes_t.description: Contains notes which are specific to the current context.

items.description: Is a place to put all manner of text blobs related to the current context.

audience.description: Indicate who is intended to read it.
audience.title: Audience of note

category.description: Choice of what kind of note this is.
category.title: Note category

text.description: The contents of the note. Content varies depending on type.
text.title: Note contents

title.description: Provides a concise description of what is contained in the text of the note.
title.title: Title of note

items.title: Note

notes_t.title: List of notes

product_group_id_t.description: Token required to identify a group of products so that it can be referred to from other parts in the document. There is no predefined or required format for the product_group_id as long as it uniquely identifies a group in the context of the current document.
product_group_id_t.title: Reference token for product group instance

product_groups_t.description: Specifies a list of product_group_ids to give context to the parent item.
product_groups_t.title: List of product_group_ids

product_id_t.description: Token required to identify a full_product_name so that it can be referred to from other parts in the document. There is no predefined or required format for the product_id as long as it uniquely identifies a product in the context of the current document.
product_id_t.title: Reference token for product instance

products_t.description: Specifies a list of product_ids to give context to the parent item.
products_t.title: List of product_ids

items.description: Holds any reference to conferences, papers, advisories, and other resources that are related and considered related to either a surrounding part of or the entire document and to be of value to the document consumer.

category.description: Indicates whether the reference points to the same document or vulnerability in focus (depending on scope) or to an external resource.
category.title: Category of reference

summary.description: Indicates what this reference refers to.
summary.title: Summary of the reference

url.description: Provides the URL for the reference.
url.title: URL of reference

items.title: Reference

version_t.description: Specifies a version string to denote clearly the evolution of the content of the document. Format must be either integer or semantic versioning.
version_t.title: Version

description: Representation of security advisory information as a JSON document.

document.description: Captures the meta-data about this document describing a particular set of security advisories.

acknowledgments.description: Contains a list of acknowledgment elements associated with the whole document.
acknowledgments.title: Document acknowledgments

aggregate_severity.description: Is a vehicle that is provided by the document producer to convey the urgency and criticality with which the one or more vulnerabilities reported should be addressed. It is a document-level metric and applied to the document as a whole — not any specific vulnerability. The range of values in this field is defined according to the document producer's policies and procedures.

namespace.description: Points to the namespace so referenced.
namespace.title: Namespace of aggregate severity

text.description: Provides a severity which is independent of - and in addition to - any other standard metric for determining the impact or severity of a given vulnerability (such as CVSS).
text.title: Text of aggregate severity

aggregate_severity.title: Aggregate severity

category.description: Defines a short canonical name, chosen by the document producer, which will inform the end user as to the category of document.
category.title: Document category

csaf_version.description: Gives the version of the CSAF specification which the document was generated for.
csaf_version.title: CSAF version

distribution.description: Describe any constraints on how this document might be shared.

text.description: Provides a textual description of additional constraints.
examples: Copyright 2021, Example Company, All Rights Reserved.
Share only on a need-to-know-basis only.
text.title: Textual description

tlp.description: Provides details about the TLP classification of the document.

label.description: Provides the TLP label of the document.
label.title: Label of TLP

url.description: Provides a URL where to find the textual description of the TLP version which is used in this document. Default is the URL to the definition by FIRST.
url.title: URL of TLP version

tlp.title: Traffic Light Protocol (TLP)

distribution.title: Rules for sharing document

lang.description: Identifies the language used by this document, corresponding to IETF BCP 47 / RFC 5646.
lang.title: Document language

notes.description: Holds notes associated with the whole document.
notes.title: Document notes

publisher.description: Provides information about the publisher of the document.

category.description: Provides information about the category of publisher releasing the document.
category.title: Category of publisher

contact_details.description: Information on how to contact the publisher, possibly including details such as web sites, email addresses, phone numbers, and postal mail addresses.
examples: Example Company can be reached at contact_us@example.com, or via our website at https://www.example.com/contact.
contact_details.title: Contact details

issuing_authority.description: Provides information about the authority of the issuing party to release the document, in particular, the party's constituency and responsibilities or other obligations.
issuing_authority.title: Issuing authority

name.description: Contains the name of the issuing party.
name.title: Name of publisher

namespace.description: Contains a URL which is under control of the issuing party and can be used as a globally unique identifier for that issuing party.
namespace.title: Namespace of publisher

publisher.title: Publisher

references.description: Holds a list of references associated with the whole document.
references.title: Document references

source_lang.description: If this copy of the document is a translation then the value of this property describes from which language this document was translated.
source_lang.title: Source language

title.description: This SHOULD be a canonical name for the document, and sufficiently unique to distinguish it from similar documents.
examples: Cisco IPv6 Crafted Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability
Example Company Cross-Site-Scripting Vulnerability in Example Generator
title.title: Title of this document

tracking.description: Is a container designated to hold all management attributes necessary to track a CSAF document as a whole.

aliases.description: Contains a list of alternate names for the same document.

items.description: Specifies a non-empty string that represents a distinct optional alternative ID used to refer to the document.
items.title: Alternate name

aliases.title: Aliases

current_release_date.description: The date when the current revision of this document was released
current_release_date.title: Current release date

generator.description: Is a container to hold all elements related to the generation of the document. These items will reference when the document was actually created, including the date it was generated and the entity that generated it.

date.description: This SHOULD be the current date that the document was generated. Because documents are often generated internally by a document producer and exist for a nonzero amount of time before being released, this field MAY be different from the Initial Release Date and Current Release Date.
date.title: Date of document generation

engine.description: Contains information about the engine that generated the CSAF document.

name.description: Represents the name of the engine that generated the CSAF document.
name.title: Engine name

version.description: Contains the version of the engine that generated the CSAF document.
version.title: Engine version

engine.title: Engine of document generation

generator.title: Document generator

id.description: The ID is a simple label that provides for a wide range of numbering values, types, and schemes. Its value SHOULD be assigned and maintained by the original document issuing authority.
id.title: Unique identifier for the document

initial_release_date.description: The date when this document was first published.
initial_release_date.title: Initial release date

revision_history.description: Holds one revision item for each version of the CSAF document, including the initial one.

items.description: Contains all the information elements required to track the evolution of a CSAF document.

date.description: The date of the revision entry
date.title: Date of the revision

legacy_version.description: Contains the version string used in an existing document with the same content.
legacy_version.title: Legacy version of the revision

summary.description: Holds a single non-empty string representing a short description of the changes.
summary.title: Summary of the revision

items.title: Revision

revision_history.title: Revision history

status.description: Defines the draft status of the document.
status.title: Document status

tracking.title: Tracking

document.title: Document level meta-data

product_tree.description: Is a container for all fully qualified product names that can be referenced elsewhere in the document.

full_product_names.description: Contains a list of full product names.
full_product_names.title: List of full product names

product_groups.description: Contains a list of product groups.

items.description: Defines a new logical group of products that can then be referred to in other parts of the document to address a group of products with a single identifier.

product_ids.description: Lists the product_ids of those products which known as one group in the document.
product_ids.title: List of Product IDs

summary.description: Gives a short, optional description of the group.
examples: The x64 versions of the operating system.
summary.title: Summary of the product group

items.title: Product group

product_groups.title: List of product groups

items.description: Establishes a link between two existing full_product_name_t elements, allowing the document producer to define a combination of two products that form a new full_product_name entry.

category.description: Defines the category of relationship for the referenced component.
category.title: Relationship category

product_reference.description: Holds a Product ID that refers to the Full Product Name element, which is referenced as the first element of the relationship.
product_reference.title: Product reference

relates_to_product_reference.description: Holds a Product ID that refers to the Full Product Name element, which is referenced as the second element of the relationship.
relates_to_product_reference.title: Relates to product reference

items.title: Relationship

product_tree.title: Product tree

vulnerabilities.description: Represents a list of all relevant vulnerability information items.

items.description: Is a container for the aggregation of all fields that are related to a single vulnerability in the document.

acknowledgments.description: Contains a list of acknowledgment elements associated with this vulnerability item.
acknowledgments.title: Vulnerability acknowledgments

cve.description: Holds the MITRE standard Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) tracking number for the vulnerability.
cve.title: CVE

cwe.description: Holds the MITRE standard Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) for the weakness associated.

id.description: Holds the ID for the weakness associated.
id.title: Weakness ID

name.description: Holds the full name of the weakness as given in the CWE specification.
examples: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
name.title: Weakness name

cwe.title: CWE

discovery_date.description: Holds the date and time the vulnerability was originally discovered.
discovery_date.title: Discovery date

flags.description: Contains a list of machine readable flags.

items.description: Contains product specific information in regard to this vulnerability as a single machine readable flag.

date.description: Contains the date when assessment was done or the flag was assigned.
date.title: Date of the flag

items.title: Flag

flags.title: List of flags

ids.description: Represents a list of unique labels or tracking IDs for the vulnerability (if such information exists).

items.description: Contains a single unique label or tracking ID for the vulnerability.

system_name.description: Indicates the name of the vulnerability tracking or numbering system.
system_name.title: System name

text.description: Is unique label or tracking ID for the vulnerability (if such information exists).
text.title: Text

items.title: ID

ids.title: List of IDs

items.description: Is a container, that allows the document producers to comment on the level of involvement (or engagement) of themselves or third parties in the vulnerability identification, scoping, and remediation process.

date.description: Holds the date and time of the involvement entry.
date.title: Date of involvement

party.description: Defines the category of the involved party.
party.title: Party category

status.description: Defines contact status of the involved party.
status.title: Party status

summary.description: Contains additional context regarding what is going on.
summary.title: Summary of the involvement

items.title: Involvement

notes.description: Holds notes associated with this vulnerability item.
notes.title: Vulnerability notes

product_status.description: Contains different lists of product_ids which provide details on the status of the referenced product related to the current vulnerability.

first_affected.description: These are the first versions of the releases known to be affected by the vulnerability.
first_affected.title: First affected

first_fixed.description: These versions contain the first fix for the vulnerability but may not be the recommended fixed versions.
first_fixed.title: First fixed

fixed.description: These versions contain a fix for the vulnerability but may not be the recommended fixed versions.
fixed.title: Fixed

known_affected.description: These versions are known to be affected by the vulnerability.
known_affected.title: Known affected

known_not_affected.description: These versions are known not to be affected by the vulnerability.
known_not_affected.title: Known not affected

last_affected.description: These are the last versions in a release train known to be affected by the vulnerability. Subsequently released versions would contain a fix for the vulnerability.
last_affected.title: Last affected

recommended.description: These versions have a fix for the vulnerability and are the vendor-recommended versions for fixing the vulnerability.
recommended.title: Recommended

under_investigation.description: It is not known yet whether these versions are or are not affected by the vulnerability. However, it is still under investigation - the result will be provided in a later release of the document.
under_investigation.title: Under investigation

product_status.title: Product status

references.description: Holds a list of references associated with this vulnerability item.
references.title: Vulnerability references

release_date.description: Holds the date and time the vulnerability was originally released into the wild.
release_date.title: Release date

items.description: Specifies details on how to handle (and presumably, fix) a vulnerability.

category.description: Specifies the category which this remediation belongs to.
category.title: Category of the remediation

date.description: Contains the date from which the remediation is available.
date.title: Date of the remediation

details.description: Contains a thorough human-readable discussion of the remediation.
details.title: Details of the remediation

items.description: Contains any possible vendor-defined constraints for obtaining fixed software or hardware that fully resolves the vulnerability.
items.title: Entitlement of the remediation

restart_required.description: Provides information on category of restart is required by this remediation to become effective.

category.description: Specifies what category of restart is required by this remediation to become effective.
category.title: Category of restart

details.description: Provides additional information for the restart. This can include details on procedures, scope or impact.
details.title: Additional restart information

restart_required.title: Restart required by remediation

url.description: Contains the URL where to obtain the remediation.
url.title: URL to the remediation

items.title: Remediation

scores.description: contains score objects for the current vulnerability.

items.description: specifies information about (at least one) score of the vulnerability and for which products the given value applies.
items.title: Score

scores.title: List of scores

threats.description: Contains information about a vulnerability that can change with time.

items.description: Contains the vulnerability kinetic information. This information can change as the vulnerability ages and new information becomes available.

category.description: Categorizes the threat according to the rules of the specification.
category.title: Category of the threat

date.description: Contains the date when the assessment was done or the threat appeared.
date.title: Date of the threat

details.description: Represents a thorough human-readable discussion of the threat.
details.title: Details of the threat

items.title: Threat

threats.title: List of threats

title.description: Gives the document producer the ability to apply a canonical name or title to the vulnerability.
title.title: Title

items.title: Vulnerability

vulnerabilities.title: Vulnerabilities

title: Common Security Advisory Framework
